function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Feeling of isolation among residents in gated communities","category":"Living","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to comprehend the problems associated with the coronavirus","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Operational restrictions impacting workforce productivity","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of research on the consequences of covid-19 on the us construction industry.","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Absence of exploration of new construction-related research areas or streams due to covid-19.","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on external organizations for the development of best practices and guidelines","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate compliance with safety steps, job-site hygiene, social distancing, and personal protective equipment","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in the application of sick leave policies for construction workers, especially those paid on a daily basis","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rise of new technologies for real-time tracking of employee health and covid-19 symptoms","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of remote management applications and technologies","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for conflicts and disputes in the construction industry leading to cost and schedule overruns.","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disputes over direct vs. incidental impacts of the pandemic on project parties","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in lien claims and related disputes in construction industry","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective culture based on resilience, change management, and agile principles","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of real-life data or full business cases to evaluate the quantitative impacts of the coronavirus pandemic","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of projector company-specific data due to limited data tracking during the pandemic","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of validation for research results","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in acquiring quantitative data during a pandemic","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New research streams related to workforce-related issues, project and workplace considerations, procurement and supply chain implications, and contractual, legal, and insurance aspects.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying on wearable devices for early detection of asymptomatic and pre-symptomatic cases of covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of smartwatch data and self-reported symptoms to detect covid-19 may lead to false positives or false negatives.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on online detection algorithms may lead to privacy and data security risks for participants’ health data.","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on large datasets for training detection algorithms","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Algorithmic decision-making process reliant on sensor data could be influenced by external factors such as travel, diet, and other health conditions, leading to inaccurate diagnostic outcomes.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurements due to external factors influencing analyte concentrations in sweat.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Face masks with integrated sensors could provide a false sense of security if not properly calibrated or maintained.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Individualized decision-making based on large volumes of data may not be accurate or effective in predicting infected individuals.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges related to data security, encryption, ethics, and regulation may arise from the integrated approach of continuous data collection and communication.","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on data mining and machine learning may lead to over-reliance on correlations and inaccurate predictions.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to occupant health research","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on subjective assessments for health evaluation","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relation between ieq indoor environmental quality and fatigue, tiredness, headaches, and attention/focus in office and educational buildings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for delivering buildings that support and promote occupant health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for human-building interactions and spatial organization","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Distribution of survey through social media outlets and online networks","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Not all respondents answering all survey questions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Online survey with open comment question on health in buildings may pose privacy and confidentiality risks for respondents.","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Multiple-choice questions with no restrictions on the number of answers may lead to data ambiguity and incomplete information.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Professionals’ responses may vary based on individual perspectives and biases, leading to subjective data collection.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data-related challenges in achieving design and operation of buildings that promote occupant health.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mix of academia and industry respondents may lead to conflicting views on occupant health in buildings.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited representation of doctors and public health workers in the survey may lead to a lack of expertise in health assessment.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic impact on building professional opinions may result in temporary shifts that are not sustainable for long-term health assessment strategies.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unequal focus on physical well-being in research","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Professional focus on holistic approach to building health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Skewed focus on physical well-being in literature review","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concentration loss and stress as part of sick building syndrome","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collaboration needed between building scientists and health professionals","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on occupant assessments and judgments for post-occupancy evaluation may lead to inaccurate or biased data regarding the indoor environment.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on subjective questionnaires for health assessments in buildings","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
